website_summaries.verdict: While the Canon Pixma MG5620 is a capable machine with an easy set-up process and an attractive set of features, its high cost of consumables cuts into the overall value.
pros: Excellent output quality, includes auto-duplexer for double-sided prints, easy to set-up and connect with a wireless network and mobile devices
cons: Expensive ink costs limit heavy photo printing and the unit lacks a media card bay
There are better deals in the same price range

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy this product from this seller
customer_reviews.text: Within a month the printer quit recognizing the computer and other devices from which I was trying to print. I had to hardwire them all. Then, the scanner stopped scanning as PDFs and only scanned as JPEGS. I cant send JPEGS to my business associates and customers. Now, even when plugged into the USB of my computer, the scanner will not recognize the computer and other mobile devices, saying the printer/scanner is not recognized. Three months and the seller will not let me return it. I am stuck with yet another printer that doesnt work and 2 year's worth of cartridges. Check return policies before purchasing. Unfortunately, electronic devices dont always stop working within the first 25-30 days.
customer_reviews.author: KST

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk, don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: It started out great, no problems. I mainly used it for scanning. Then after 3 months it randomly decided to stop scanning. The help documentation is worthless, because the computer recognizes it as a printer and a scanner, but when I open the scanner it just says idle. When I open other apps to try and get around this problem they do not recognize the scanner. So, yet another printer is rendered totally useless and a waste of money. Skip ahead to a month later and now the paper will not load, even when it's full of paper. Worthless just became garbage for my kids to play hockey with. Shame on you Canon!
customer_reviews.author: One Lonely Sister

customer_reviews.title: constant feeder problem
customer_reviews.text: Of course, this printer has the usual problem of going through expensive toner way too fast. That's to be expected in this industry, as that's the way they make their money. The surprising issue, though, is that it keeps telling me there is no paper in the feeder, when there is clearly a healthy stack of paper in the feeder, and I've followed the prompts to tell the printer it's there. This is hugely frustrating. Eventually, after several resets and pushes, I can get it to work, but there is obviously a fitting problem or a sensor problem, such that it takes way too much work and time to get something printed.
customer_reviews.author: t-man

customer_reviews.title: I am Canon fan and this is the worse product ever
customer_reviews.text: I receive error messages everytime I try to use this printer. I am Canon fan and this is the worse product ever. It tells me no paper when there is paper and several other messages over this printer. I purchased another Canon printer for another area of the house and it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Because I have a Chromebook requiring cloud printing, I ...
customer_reviews.text: Because I have a Chromebook requiring cloud printing, I chose this printer because of its cloud capability. Unfortunately, after setting it up, I discovered it is not compatible with a Chromebook. In addiiton, I had trouble with the open and close paper tray commands. I couldn't get past that point, the commands kept repeating back and forth, so printing was out of the question. That may have been my fault as I am not very computer tech savvy. It was accepted for return by the shipper, but I was to pay for return shipping, which for me was almost $17(NC to NY.) The refund was full price.
customer_reviews.author: Marabelle

customer_reviews.title: Beats HP
customer_reviews.text: Not totally impressed with the quality of scanner. For some reason, it makes better copies than scans to file. NOT sure how that is possible. Really slow and noisy to start up but, once it's going, it works great. Love the double sided printing feature. Overall, worth the money and seems better than my old HP. Love the separate cartridges and ability to keep printing when a color runs out. One thing I have not gotten working correctly... yet... is printing from an Android phone. Did what seemed to be the right things and I can only get very bad printouts from certain apps. Nothing like what I get on a PC. Still trying to solve that riddle.
customer_reviews.author: Maavalous1

customer_reviews.title: Canon Pixma MG5620 Wireless All-in-one Inkjet...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this over a year ago. It still works but since new it goes through a rather long process before it prints. That can take a minute or so then it may say the cassette is out of paper. This happens a lot even though it has paper. So I reset the alignment marks to register the paper. Fortunately I print very little so I just deal with it. I should mention I only do that once at the beginning. Other than that it prints & scans just fine plus the cartridges are very reasonable. If you print a lot I would buy a better unit.
customer_reviews.author: R. Elliott

customer_reviews.title: This is the worst printer I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst printer I have ever had. It didn't even make it through one cycle of ink before it began to have problems. It doesn't want to communicate with the computers without having to reboot everything constantly. Then it began to have paper issues. It wouldn't take the paper in and had a warning that there was no paper. Then, it took in a big batch of paper which all got jammed. Now I'm getting another paper issue warning that I cannot figure out. I hate this printer, and I will never buy another Canon.
customer_reviews.author: southernnm

customer_reviews.title: Got this printer based on reviews & in cartridge prices ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this printer based on reviews & in cartridge prices (we get "xl" cartridge set for about $26). Ink lasts "ok"; our last hp regular ink lasted longer, but cost more. As long as I remember to print text documents "in black and white" the cartridges last a long time. Their 'black only' ink lasts longer than graphics-black; so remember to print in b&w when you can.
customer_reviews.author: Josh A.

customer_reviews.title: DON'T DO IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: p.o.s. Paper feed either says no paper, or if by some miracle the paper begins to load, it jams. Just like the last one. Only ordered this one again hoping it was a fluke because we had so much backup ink. CanonPixma is shitschmah. There's more. I called and they sent me a new printer, except it's the Pixma MG5720, which does not take the $50+ in cartridges I own. And the cartridges for it are only available through canon. Would cost me $70+ for cartridges alone. Scam city. And guess what, the 5720 is jamming now as well after being hooked up a week, HP3830, here I come!
customer_reviews.author: podunko

customer_reviews.title: Good price for a good printer
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely happy I picked up this printer last year. I've used it regularly for printing and scanning over the past year and it has worked to perfection. It was simple to get set up and I haven't had any trouble using it since I got it. I haven't used it enough (like someone who may use it on a daily basis) to get a very in-depth review, but if you are someone who needs a high quality printer/scanner for your everyday needs then I recommend this Canon printer. It works perfectly for the average person and is overall a good price.
customer_reviews.author: LawSchoolHopeful

customer_reviews.title: Print quality is good but wastes ink...
customer_reviews.text: Having been using this for a couple of years and for the price it's a good printer/copier. Only complaint is that it dumps ink (cleans jets) way too often and the software is a bit annoying. I've had very good luck with Linkyo brand, after-market ink. Using a quality after-market ink is the only thing that makes this printer affordable to operate.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: packaging was good. Installation was straightforward but you must read and ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this machine to replace a Lexmark item that stopped working. Delivery, packaging was good. Installation was straightforward but you must read and follow the instructions. The print quality is good. I do not use the photo print function, so no comment. Scanning is OK. I expect ink usage to be bad but I do not need to print very much. The machine seems slow for all functions; I keep the power on all the time because it takes forever to start up from power saver mode. Overall the printer is pretty much what I expected for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: djap

customer_reviews.title: My friends at Consumer Reports evaluated this product better than I could possibly do -- unless I bought ...
customer_reviews.text: My friends at Consumer Reports evaluated this product better than I could possibly do -- unless I bought many different products, tested each to exasustion, and then wrote up my analyses on a spreadsheet. I'm retired. I don't have the expertise or resources, so I relied on CU. The product seems well designed and manufactured. It produces good results; I was most interested in printing color photographs at home. Only a professional photo lab can do better and their equipment and skills are vastly superior to mine. Now I get to test various paper to learn which makes and types suit me best.
customer_reviews.author: Don K in Alaska

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed in this machine
customer_reviews.text: very disappointed in this machine. this replaced a canon printer I loved but that one came with user instructions. I am not technically talented & need instructions for stuff,at least what all the buttons do but this printer.......nothing, not even a disc. had to find the manual on line, not easy either, and get a pdf version saved on my pc. finding anything in that is another daunting chore. now, all of a sudden my wireless capability is gone & I had to piug in the cord to use it. sorry I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Loreta Petrilli

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in Feature, But Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I previously owned a Canon PIXMA MG5420 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner and Copier. While the MG5620 model has the same features of scanning and copying, it does not have the option on your screen/PC of printing double sided. The printed paper falls on the floor if the printer extends over a table/desk/credenza. There is no option for the printer to automatically turn on when you print as the MG5420 model has. Because my MG5420 broke 2 years after I purchased it, I chose to pick up the extended warranty offered with this model. It was something like $5 for a 3 or 4 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: WiFi works!
customer_reviews.text: They have the best product support. You talk to a person in the U.S. which I like and their support is free and lasts forever. It has a strong WiFi signal which I wanted so I can print from anywhere I am connected to my network. Not a high-priced printer either so that is good too. Be careful when calling support because on a search engine you can be given the wrong number. I was connected to India so I knew that wasn't really Canon. You can print pictures, envelopes,any sized paper. It is a great home printer.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Tara 8

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer when installed properly!
customer_reviews.text: Great printer - once it is set up. FIRST: install the software from the CD and THEN FOLLOW the on-screen instructions. Once the software is installed, select the connection method and start it up. DISREGARD the installation sheet that came with the printer and says nothing about the CD; it would have you running an alignment sheet before the print cartridges are properly recognized. Canon Customer Service was OUTSTANDING in helping with the installation: told me to install the CD and follow those steps. Worked great. Again, DISREGARD the installation sheet that came with the printer!
customer_reviews.author: Euro Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Major problem
customer_reviews.text: It was a good printer for almost 5 years.... and then one day it started showing error code that the print head was incorrect. Tried restarting, fixing, researching..... you can't fix it, I'll have to throw it away and buy the new one.
customer_reviews.author: Tarik Bosniak

customer_reviews.title: Canon: Who Needs Stinking Policies?
customer_reviews.text: This printer performs as wonderfully as the one it replaced. It was the Canon Pixma iP4700. That model was discontinued. And while other customers who bought this printer insist the ink doesn't last as long as what replacement tanks do, it came with full ink tanks. At least mine did. And I'm still using the tanks that came with the printer. I may not agree with Canon's policy on dealing with printers that simply stop working, but with the obvious superior quality of their merchandise, I insist on remaining a loyal customer. When this printer finally fails I'll be buying another Canon ink jet.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Seibert Jr

customer_reviews.title: Good but somewhat non intuitive. paper storage a problem
customer_reviews.text: connected easily. printer great. copier ok but scanner very odd and non intuitive also insists on filing things where IT want's to. prints on the underside but does duplex automatically. I miss the top or internal paper holder as both front panels have to be open if there is paper to the ready. I would have bought 2 more ( I use a lot of printers) to keep my ink needs sane but this open paper front is a bummer. it works well with the ink I bought from Sophia Global instead of the cannon costly stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Mama

customer_reviews.title: Printer/scanner works great. Put up with a significant amount of abuse ...
customer_reviews.text: Printer/scanner works great. Put up with a significant amount of abuse (daughter left it in the garage for two weeks--"I was printing pictures with my friends Dad gawd". Has individual cartridges for all the colors so we don't have to throw out unused colors. Very pleased with both document printing and photo printing, would buy again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Dum

customer_reviews.title: I really like it.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up. I was immediately able to print from my laptop(Win 8.1) and iPad. I haven't been able to print from my desktop(Win 7), but I haven't actually spent much time trying. The printer shows up as the default, but nothing prints. I rarely use the desktop, so it isn't a problem yet. Really pleased with the print quality and the double-sided printing ability. I'll give it a five (probably) when I get the desktop to print.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis OBrien

customer_reviews.title: not great
customer_reviews.text: ink runs fast and is expensive..printer is less than ink. I probably spent $50 on ink for less than 50 printed papers. photos never came out well. if one color runs out the whole thing wouldn't print. would have been OK with only B&W for most print jobs, but not an option. color wasn't great. we switched to laser (B&W) and are loving it!
customer_reviews.author: smitty

customer_reviews.title: Bought this as a recommended printer for edible prints using edible ink
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a recommended printer for edible prints using edible ink. Never worked correctly for me on a special order and I ended up using it as a regular printer. Works fine for that, updated drivers are needed often though. Does not plug and play as easily as stated either, but in newer computers, this hasn't been as much of a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Sese

customer_reviews.title: Nifty little printer at a very reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: No complaints on this nice printer. I do wish it had an ADF function, though. This printer was easy to install on my wireless network...all went smoothly. I like the idea that the printer wakes up when a print job comes through. I also wish the inner door (paper feed area) didn't have to be opened for each print job, though; I like to keep it closed when not printing to eliminate dust collecting inside. The only other complaint I would have is that the replacement ink cartridges are so expensive!
customer_reviews.author: nvr2amzd

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to set up on my network
customer_reviews.text: I have this quite awhile now. It was easy to set up on my network. However, it just wont print. I have spent hours online and on phone with technical support. When it decides it will print it get 2 pages in and have a paper jam. But no paper is actually jammmed. Then it says it is out of paper, but the tray is full. It just wont pick up the paper. Love the way the colors are seperate cartilages. But the toner black is used so fast have had to replace after printing 70 pages. Going back to HP. Dont recommend based on my issues.
customer_reviews.author: Giselle

customer_reviews.title: Canon Pixma is full of disappointment save your money go elsewhere for a printer
customer_reviews.text: So far hooking this up to the internet to get it to print wireless has not yet happened. I purchased this because it said it had wireless printing What it doesn't say its such a pain to hook up. What it also doesn't tell you is whether or not you are physically connected to the printer or not--if your wifi goes down it will not print at all. When it does print it does a great job that's why it got 2 stars--but really should be 1 1/2 So far Amazon has sold me a bunch of crap this go around. UPDATE: I threw it into the trash!
customer_reviews.author: DeShawn Hatcher

customer_reviews.title: Great, in theory. No-go in practice!
customer_reviews.text: The printer started throwing codes (6000 was one) right out of the box. It wasn't resolved through standard troubleshooting, so I proceeded to waste hours of my life on the phone with what must be the world's worst customer service. However, they were able to ascertain that it wasn't a working printer and needed to be replaced. Nifty, that. Filing this under lessons learned; will look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Megster

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: It lasted 2 years. It was ok during that time. I had problems getting it to stay connected to the wi-fi. I had to reset it every time after the first year. Then, I just got an error code B203 and it told me to call Customer Service. It seems something is wrong with the hardware and I have to take it to a service provider- only there are none in my area. I have to buy a new printer and it won't be this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine M

customer_reviews.title: less the 6 months in and its not working right.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer less then 6 months ago and I'm already having issues with it. When you print something it pulls multiple papers in to print and then jams. Ive tired troubleshooting to correct the issue with no avail. The worst part for me is in the 6 months of owning this printer I've probably only printed 40 maybe 50 papers. Im very disappointed with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Shayla Clegg

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.  Easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: I would give this printer a 5 star rating except I have only printed a few black and white pages so far. Set up was very easy. Wireless printing works most of the time. Occasionally you need to go to printer and press a button to sort of wake it up. Then for the next several pages it works perfect. My previous printer of a different make did the same thing. I guess if they sit long enough they go into a sleep mode. ?????? Otherwise I think it's fine. Faster than my previous unit. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Richard G. Maner

customer_reviews.title: if only the software would install!
customer_reviews.text: Good printer in theory. Unfortunately not compatible with windows 8 asus laptop? problem is the printer driver fails to install properly. printer works nice for cloud print but it's annoying to have to use that and not any comprehensive option. I simply cannot printer directly from my computer,though scan works. tech support were quick to respond and tried many ways to resolve. Ultimately they told me to contact the manufacturer. I haven't, kind of gave up. If it worked perfectly I'd give 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be working well
customer_reviews.text: So far this printer seems to be working well for our PC's and laptops, however we still haven't figured out how to print from the Chromebook, although this printer is supposedly "cloud ready." Also the wireless works much better than the old HP all in one I had. Plus it's much sleeker and smaller. But I can tell the ink is going to run out quickly--probably just "starter packs".
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good printer, frustrating interface, difficult to configure for the cloud
customer_reviews.text: Solid printer. Difficult to setup networking capabilities, like print to Google Drive or other platforms. Control buttons and display are awkward with an inconsistent user interface, that although isn't problematic is aggravating. Drivers don't support choosing color or b/w when printing from Google Cloud Print (the one reason we purchased this printer, to replace our non-cloud print enabled one). One would wonder if Canon had someone actually try to use this to setup these features before sending to customers.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value and great features!
customer_reviews.text: I love being ab le to print from my tablet and phone! I look up a lot of crochet patterns, and it's nice being able to just print the ones I want from my phone since that is what I have with me most of the time and what I use to look up patterns! It did take some research to figure out how to add my husband's google account to it so we could both print from our mobile devices, but I finally figured it out and it works well. I actually also bought my parents one of these for Christmas so they could print from their mobile devices. :)
customer_reviews.author: Grammy18

customer_reviews.title: SLOWEST PRINTER ON RECORD
customer_reviews.text: Quite possibly slower than the first dot matrix printer I had in high school. It is insane. Print quality is also remarkably bad. Colors are off no matter how many times I try to recalibrate. Slightly comforted by the fact that I am not the only one suffering through this (thank you other reviewers). I'm still going to give it away, however, so I am not continuously reminded of the complete failure of in judgment that I exercised in purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: jodi-c

customer_reviews.title: Pixma MG5620 meeting all expectations so far
customer_reviews.text: The Pixma MG5620 meets all of my expectations so far. I have owned other Canon printers and they have all been exceptional. The final test will be to monitor how much it costs to operate. The HP printer this Pixma is replacing was an ink hog that cost nearly $100.00 (at Sams) to replace the ink cartridge set. I set the HP out with the garbage, even though it worked OK, just to get rid of the $300.00 +/year operating cost for these two old retirees.
customer_reviews.author: F. Alan Garten

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: This appeared to be the best replacement for our old PIXMA IP3000. But is has trouble recognizing that there is paper in the tray which is very annoying. Having a wireless printer is pointless if you have to get up and walk across the house with your laptop in hand and take the paper in and out several times till the printer finally decides there is paper present. The software package is also a little over the top if you just want to scan something in a hurry without have to figure out where it put the file.
customer_reviews.author: Lytspace

customer_reviews.title: Suggest you look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the MG5620 last September. By March, it was dead. Called Canon, they quickly replaced it with a newer model, the TS6020. Now that one is dead. I'm done with Canon printers. This was my first purchase of their brand, hoping for a solid all around ink-jet that did not take up too much space. I've had nothing but frustration at trying to make it function. I use Windows 10, keep my drivers and software/firmware up to date and it simply is not enough to keep this printer alive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, not an ink guzzler
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for a little over 3 months now and have been very satisfied with it. The low ink level notification came on about 40 sheets of paper ago, and this guy just keeps on printing. I've been printing on heavy card stock and it has not jammed yet or given me any attitude at all (I had a lot of trouble with my old HP printer). The colors have not printed on the card stock as bright as I would like, which is why I am giving it 4 stars. It's also very big and takes up a lot of room in my workspace.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Features But Low Quality
customer_reviews.text: This was really nice while it worked, but it has died after less than 3 years. One day it decided to print blank pages and no amount of cleaning could fix it. Meanwhile, my 10+ year old HP all-in-one in my home office continues to work flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fister

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This printer looks great and also works great. The wireless printing options and functionality are amazing. The scanner is very fast. It boots really fast after powering down. The white color is a great change from black or grey. I also really like the paper loading from the front. My only complaint is the scanning software. Its a bit tricky to get it to do what you want, and if you aren't paying attention it will create files for ever test past you take. You have to go in and figure out which ones were drafts.
customer_reviews.author: Rory Walsh

customer_reviews.title: this printer is TERRIBLE on every level
customer_reviews.text: this printer is TERRIBLE on every level, except print quality, which is ok. Does not stay connected, constantly jams paper, uses tons of ink. bulky. frustrating beyond measure. do not waste your money on this one.
customer_reviews.author: NMH

customer_reviews.title: Super Home Printer
customer_reviews.text: Got it up and running quickly. The only difficult step was to enter a 17 digit network mixed code into the printer. Once I did that, it was a cinch. Network printing, two sided printing, air print, scanning, and photo printing were all tested and worked very well. The only limitations I noted is that it cannot handle legal size and does not have a document feeder so it would have limited use as a business printer. Otherwise, it suits my needs as a good home printer.
customer_reviews.author: Lion Mac

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy as Canon says
customer_reviews.text: First of all it arrived two days late. READ the instructions very carefully. I almost returned because I couldn't get it to print. It has a bunch of things that have to be opened. Wi-Fi set up was awkward as I had to select numbers for a password. You keep hitting select Aa1 until you get numbers and enter your password. On a high note it printed from my iPad instantly so I ended up a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Krug

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk..28 days after the 1 year warranty expired, it suddenly stopped working. Product "support" said it's some kind of print head issue and it's just best to toss and replace. This printer gave me problems the entire (just over 1 year) time I've tried to use it. I am not buying another Canon printer. EVER
customer_reviews.author: Sewitgoes

customer_reviews.title: One thing I particularly like is that when you push the power button to ...
customer_reviews.text: This printer was a bit of a hassle to set up. Once there, it operates smoothly. One thing I particularly like is that when you push the power button to turn it on, it immediately connects wirelessly -- no waiting as with Epson printers. One thing I do not like is that to print Web pages, you must use the I.E. browser, unlike Epson, where you can use the browser of choice. I've found that H.P. has better support than either Canon or Epson -- but neither is anything to write home about.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: I have 5 canon printers, but since the new ...
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 canon printers, but since the new ones (2014, 2015) have come out, the quality has gone down tremendously. I wish I could buy 2 more from 2011. They cost more then, but they last longer. These new ones are loud, and they have more ink problems than any others
customer_reviews.author: SteveJM35

customer_reviews.title: Good budget 3-in-1
customer_reviews.text: 20 minutes to set up. Not bad. Prints quickly and crisply though it has a fairly large footprint (not good size for dorm or similar small space). Most noticeable is how noisy it is. The trays are plastic and I'm not sure how they will hold up. The screen is very legible and easy to use. Printing wirelessly from my iPad and iPhone a snap too. Overall a fairly good purchase and I like that I can replace individual ink cartridges. Good budget 3-in-1.
customer_reviews.author: AZgal

customer_reviews.title: I have had several different printers but this is my all time favorite!! For the price you can't go wrong
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of the reviews and as always they were very helpful. I have had several different printers but this is my all time favorite!! For the price you can't go wrong, the print and copy quality is excellent! The ink cartridges can be replaced with generic ones saving a lot of money! It is a fairly large size so if you want one that takes up a small area this is not for you. Personally I LOVE this printer!!
customer_reviews.author: Grannie Judy

customer_reviews.title: first one operates great, the newest one won't feed paper keeps saying ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd one of these I have bought, first one operates great, the newest one won't feed paper keeps saying out of paper. got new paper loaded carefully still will not load paper. Will not print. If it is under warranty, can it be replaced or upgraded. I need a printer. Bought an HP tried to put aftermarket ink in it and now print return will not function at all. Seem to be having bad luck,
customer_reviews.author: Betty Leach

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this for several years and still find it useful all the time. Compact and stylish, it's always at the ready. Great features like auto on/off, auto object can recognition, black/gray scale exclusive ink tank, and flawless wireless connectivity are above and beyond the expected scan, copy and photo print. I have also had flawless use with third-party inks throughout its life.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Good printer except for the output tray
customer_reviews.text: Good printer except for the output tray, which is absurdly small. Output ends up on the floor pretty much every time you print, even a single page. So unless you can put the printer in the middle of a decent sized desk or table, get used to gathering up and collating the mess. Or stand by the printer and collect the output with your hands. That's not too inconvenient, is it?
customer_reviews.author: Grendel

customer_reviews.title: I love this printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer works beautifully and is a vast improvement over the very temperamental Epson that it replaced. Great print quality in both black and white and color for every day documents. I have not tried to print photos yet. It does not yet appear to be too much of an ink hog. The set up instructions that it came with were a bit confusing, but if you go to canon's website there are video tutorials for setting everything up, which made it easy.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Rix

customer_reviews.title: great investment
customer_reviews.text: I am going to tablets and not desktop computers. This is wireless and will even print from my smartphone. It is quiet and fast and has good quality printing. is is large, so check the dimensions before you buy to make sure it will fit where you want it. Since it is wireless, it can actually go just about anywhere. Also, if you register it on line and get an account with Canon, you can download any software updates and updates for the drivers.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer!! But the setup menus are a pain in the...
customer_reviews.text: I always liked Canon printers and this one is no exception. Canon's paper handling has always been superior if you ask me, the print quality is great, it's pretty good on ink, and it's fast. The only thing I don't like about it is that the menu/functions are not very intuitive (not that the documentation helps at all because it doesn't!) - otherwise I would have given it 5 stars. But the quality and performance really makes up for it. I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: EveryDamnJim

customer_reviews.title: Effortlessly connected to wifi and great quality all in one printer!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful printer that connected effortlessly to my computer, iPad and iPhone for printing. The copy function is great as well. Responds quickly when printing is wanted. I scanned some photos with this to email and the quality of the photos looks great on the computer! I would buy this again and again and recommend to anyone needing a new printer. Great price for a Canon multi function printer!!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M

customer_reviews.title: Works great as AirPrint from our laptops
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this printer over two years ago and have no issues so far. Works great as AirPrint from our laptops, iPhones and MacBooks, any device that you set up on the same WiFi should print. Great for photos too, depending on how much dpi you need or want for photo printing. This is great for general use plus photos.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: Hard to change!
customer_reviews.text: I liked my iP4920 better. This one is slower. However, the access to change cartridges is convenient, and it IS an all-in-one, which I didn't have before. It's nice to copy and scan on the same device as just printing. And I recently received a class action notice with regard to the iP4920 because of the print head. I had been having trouble, but was unaware others had the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Reta Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Canon Pixma MG5620 Wireless - WORST PRINTER I EVER BOUGHT
customer_reviews.text: this is the WORST printer you could ever buy. DON'T DO IT. keep shopping!! not only does it only work intermittently, the links to canon customer support lead you to PAID telecommunicators (they wouldn't provide downloads or support w/o a hefty fee). after a chat with one of their reps today, looking for a replacement or refund, they denied me. needless to say, canon lost a customer. amazon support was amazing. a great company gave me an after purchase appeasement gift of 10% credit back to my account. thank you amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work right!
customer_reviews.text: Everything worked as advertised, everything went fine. But after it jammed, it stopped working, and it has never worked since. I called tech support and they ran through maintenance. It ran for a couple of pages, then today I tried to print something, It constantly says that the printer needs repair, go to a service center to repair it. Most Canon printers worked well but this printer is a nightmare. I think I'm better off with something else.
customer_reviews.author: chipmunky

customer_reviews.title: Good printer
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been a great printer! I don't use it daily and am still on the ink that came with it but it prints good color whether on photo paper, regular paper or card stock. I had no trouble with wifi hookup and it holds the signal well but my router box and thus printer are in the same room. Only thing I dislike is the lengthy process of switching from photo to regular paper. Too many steps to o thru. But I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: julie

customer_reviews.title: Printer is alright, ink is the spawn of the devil
customer_reviews.text: So we have had this printer for over a year, before that we had a different model Canon printer. At some point the older model quit printing in black ink. I had thought that since that printer was quite old that it was time to replace it anyways. Bought the MG5620 and it worked well for a year. Now we are back to the issue with it not printing ANYTHING in black. It is the ink that is the problem and who has time to deal with that. I will never purchase another Canon printer. Ever.
customer_reviews.author: nobody_dickenson

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Setup can be simplified if you read my review!
customer_reviews.text: Pain in the butt to set up, but after using my brain, found a simpler way. Do not follow the instructions it gives you, if you have a Chromebook or tablet! There is a setup on the printer that prints a verification that you need to enter to register your printer. Simply connect your printer to your internet router, then sign into your google drive on the printer. After that, you simply log onto google from anywhere and print!
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Scott Watruba

customer_reviews.title: Best printer I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Wireless printing from my laptop and iPad -Double sided printing -Scans documents as JPEG or PDF -Has paper abrasion setting which I have used to help prevent the printer from taking in too many sheets of paper - You can clean the ink rollers Cons: Consumes ink as if printers could be dehydrated
customer_reviews.author: Martina

customer_reviews.title: I am highly disappointed considering this is a good rated printer amazon reviews ...
customer_reviews.text: this printer is a pain to use. 1st complaint is that it takes forever to "warm up" if you don't have it on for a few minutes before you try printing something don't expect a quick print. my biggest complaint is that it always says it is out of paper... I will have just put paper in but nope it says "out of paper" or it pulls all the paper up at once and jams. I am highly disappointed considering this is a good rated printer amazon reviews usually don't let me down and I have had this printer since January so this is not just a one time complaint its a very useful paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: amanda stutz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value for the Money
customer_reviews.text: This ws an excellent purchase for th money. Our older Canon MP 830 was failing and needed to be replaced. This newer model does not have all the bells and whistles of the one it replaced, but for the price, it is well worth it. The main differences are that the older model had an automatic document feeder (ADF) and built in duplex printing. I think only ever used the ADF once. For the savings in money, I can reload my pages to print on the second side. I am very happy with the quality of printing. I also like that it has smaller footprint than the old MP-830.
customer_reviews.author: Nevin Miller

customer_reviews.title: Almost DOA
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer because I had enjoyed using previous Canon printers. This one lost the confidence I had in Canon products. While setting it up, you need to scan a page to align the print heads. When I pressed the button to scan, the scanner started. The machine then powered off and would not power back on. I am highly disappointed and have started the return process.
customer_reviews.author: Customer Guy

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it!
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this printer feels and is flimsy. Scanner does not work no matter how many settings I've adjusted. Photo print quality is barely ok. I would have returned this except for my wife threw away the packaging before I got a chance to use the printer. It's sad with how company's like Canon, HP, and Epson have cheapened their products over the years. I would have spent more money on their higher end products but they don't seem much better in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas L.

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat flimsy, no place to "feed" multiple pages to ...
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat flimsy, no place to "feed" multiple pages to be copied... must do one at a time. Frequent "error.. needs paper" happens when there is plenty of paper in the machine. Pictures do not come out sharp and with true color.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm disappointed because I love the printer if it keeps working
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these for use in a small business. Both printers died within days of each other. We print about 30-50 pages per day (not heavy use) and all of a sudden they start making a clicking noise and it reports there is no paper. I'm disappointed because I love the printer if it keeps working. We'll see how Canon support handles the problem.
customer_reviews.author: L. A. White

customer_reviews.title: It shouldn't be this maddening!
customer_reviews.text: It's a behemoth! I expected it to be a little more compact. More importantly, it was frustratingly difficult to set up. The instructions were not clear and the canon website was a waste of time. I finally got it going after a couple youtube videos and I'm still not sure I've got it right or how to do much of anything efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this printer much, but it seems to do the job I need just right. I use it as a home printer for scanning documents and the occasional document prints. It also is very sleek looking which is a bonus since it sits out by my desk. My only complaint was the setup process... it took forever and was not very clear. I hope it continues to work great.
customer_reviews.author: Brit

customer_reviews.title: and sounds like the Rover preparing to journey over Mars when gearing ...
customer_reviews.text: This printer is constantly "processing" for even the most basic print job, and sounds like the Rover preparing to journey over Mars when gearing up for anything more complicated. About a third of the jobs I print never make it out of the printer, as apparently it's just too much for the humble Pixma to handle. Most recently, it stopped giving me the option to print in black and white. I've literally looking at the screen displaying "Processing... Please wait momentarily" the entire time I've been writing this review. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis C. Jolly

customer_reviews.title: Over-all it's ok, but not great
customer_reviews.text: The printer prints well, but is a lot more noisy and slower than my previous Canon all-in-one printers. Also it only has one paper feed tray; no rear paper feeder entry. It does have a "duplex printing" feature to permit automatic printing on both sides of the paper, but it is very slow in reversing the paper to print on the back side. Over-all it's ok, but not great.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: This printer was super easy to set up for 5 computers on WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Ha, Imagine that! I hooked up 4 MacBook Pros, a Windows 7 desktop and then Bootcamp Windows 7 in two of the MacBook Pros ALL WiFi!!! It just worked and now we can print from wherever we have wandered in the house. We can copy with the press of a button, black and white or color. We can scan into PDF. Seriously, what more could you ask?
customer_reviews.author: Stargazey Farm

customer_reviews.title: Good overall all-in-one printer/scanner
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer based on Consumer Reports ratings. I haven't printed any photos with it yet but I love it as a everyday color printer/scanner. I've now retired my old Epson scanner and freed up valuable desk space. Pros: single-button scan, with a PDF automagically appearing on the laptop. Good quality of color printouts. Color and B&W scans are good too. Cons: menu is a bit cramped on a tiny LCD screen, and the paper loader is somewhat awkward. Overall, very happy with my purchase, I feel like I've gotten a good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Vuillermet

customer_reviews.title: Generic ink in it (4 pack for super cheap) works perfectly in it
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but can only put about a 1/2 cm thick bunch of paper in the tray at a time or it gets pissy. Generic ink in it (4 pack for super cheap) works perfectly in it.  Ink is here.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Bole

customer_reviews.title: Good Scanner, Not so Good Printer
customer_reviews.text: I got it mostly to scan documents. For this, it does very well. It's not my primary printer. I have printed a few pages and it just sounds cheap. I have a couple of other better Canon printers and they are much quieter and sound much better when printing. If you're buying this to be your primary printer, spend a few more bucks and get the Canon 920.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie & Rob

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not the best
customer_reviews.text: The printer works the way it should. I have no problems with the hardware or software. However, the colors are not as bright nor as sharp as the printer it replaced which was a HP Photosmart D7560. My comments apply specifically to printing pictures. This printer does not live up to the quality printing identified on the Amazon web site.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick A. Olivolo

customer_reviews.title: Good Printer
customer_reviews.text: The Jury is still out, somewhat on this... After waiting a full week for this printer which was to be delivered via amazon prime!!!! Finally got it- a little more complicated than I anticipated and I am still learning daily about the unit. Seems to print very well so I guess that is what it is for..
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Took forever to make the printer work ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Took forever to make the printer work with my tablets and computer. After spending 2.5 hrs on the phone with canon, they finally work. The fault was with my computer and the associate with canon worked everything out and not once did he get frustrated for being on the line for so long. Its a good product with great support. I would definitely buy canon products again.
customer_reviews.author: Gary M.

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade the firmware. Then this is a great product.
customer_reviews.text: Well. Initially I was frustrated because it didn't work with my iPhone 6 plus. Then after upgrading the firmware, which was alerted on the printer screen, it just worked. YOU HAVE TO UPGRADE THE FIRMWARE! If it were not due to this extra firmware installation, which is not user friendly, I'd give a 5 star. Printing is fast. Quality is great. Wifi setup is easy. AirPrint works seamlessly. I can print from all my PC, Mac, iPad, iPhone devices. The iOS app detects the printer automatically. And a bonus, which I didn't realize before, is that it can print both-sides. All in all, excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: D. Liu

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money!!
customer_reviews.text: Advertised as Windows 10 compatible, NOT. No manual, no instructions in anything but a Chinese version of English. On screen functions inoperable. No support. Waste of money!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived looking a little rough. Opened interior package, Zero problems! Plugged it in, installed the ink cartridges, aligned according to instructions, and started printing wirelessly, effortlessly! It is a little slow, but not bad at all. Great print quality, great price, easy to set up, easy to use...totally happy!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn M. Talbot

customer_reviews.title: Easy, great printer/scanner/copier
customer_reviews.text: Old printer was not Windows 10 compatible so got this to replace it; this is the easiest print I have ever setup, works great, and works on older versions of windows too. Can also print from Ipad and phone... Great color and b&w scanning and copying. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: consumerreporter

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer..☆HAT☆
customer_reviews.text: It is so great ..I love use it ..that I think everyone should have one.. it is wireless, and you can print for a way that is not on top of the printer..you can be out sided and need to print you can do it .. you don't have to wait until it is done .. you can walk away.. yes I give it a 5 star.. thank you and God bless.. ☆HAT☆
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Henry *HAT*

customer_reviews.title: Every print job an adventure!
customer_reviews.text: If you want a printer that constantly thinks it has no paper, even when it does, this is the printer for you! Sometimes you get to hit "ok" after each page when it tells you there's no paper and it will keep printing. Sometimes even that doesn't work. Every time is an exciting adventure!
customer_reviews.author: K. Purcell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Printer So Far, Excellent Photos And Text
customer_reviews.text: This one was a very pleasant surprise. It's the highest rated inkjet in a major consumer magazine. They didn't recommended it because I guess it apparently uses a lot of ink maintaining the print head. But it's only $70 and it's very well designed as are all Canon printers I've used. You may want to go with the newer model, though.
customer_reviews.author: Doug T.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like it alot. Great price. Ask me for a revue after a few months usage After months of owning this unit, I find the ink usage very bad. Inks are expensive no matter the printer and this color cartridges have emptied WAY too soon. It IS a great printer though. Aside from ink, it does everything mentioned and you sure can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Fred C Dobbs

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer in 2015 and used it about once a month, having printed probably 100 pages or less. Now it is giving me an error message and won't function. When I called Canon about it, they told me the error message means it's a hardware problem and the printer needs to be repaired or replaced. My previous printers (HP) have lasted me many years. I will NEVER buy another Canon printer.
customer_reviews.author: Lee A. Brown

customer_reviews.title: It prints color photographs beautifully although I'm trying to minimize the number of color ...
customer_reviews.text: Slightly more difficult to set up than the previous Canon wireless printer but no problems once I got it going. It prints color photographs beautifully although I'm trying to minimize the number of color prints. I haven't used copying or faxing as yet (does anyone still use fax?). For the price it is really great.
customer_reviews.author: timc

customer_reviews.title: Good printer for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Good printer for the price and gets the job done. My only complaint is that the paper tray has to be open for it to print. I don't like leaving my paper tray open all of the time....I always have to go and open it so it will print. Maybe I just always need to leave it open.
customer_reviews.author: Ivanna

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: This printer is a piece of junk.. Purchased three years ago, use it minimally for pictures and color projects. It has gone off-line repeatedly and now has an unrepairable problem. Don't waste your money. Now I'm looking for a good solid replacement.
customer_reviews.author: DWentz

customer_reviews.title: This priter is great! Easy to setup and wireless is flawless
customer_reviews.text: This priter is great! Easy to setup and wireless is flawless. Tech support by Canon is frst rate with USA support. Thisw printer is a replacement for an expensive and is 1,000 times better in erformance and ease of operation. Thank you for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis R. Moriarty

customer_reviews.title: Good Printer, but also Good Sized
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and prints great, but it's quite a bit bigger than I thought it would be. I know the measurements are listed, but it's hard to picture. If I were you, I'd find a box or something that measures about the same, and use that as a guide, because this is a pretty big printer.
customer_reviews.author: Tealdee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on budget all in one printers. This one is a bargain at $70. No issues so far. Easy to setup, AirPrint works great. It is a little loud as others noted, but not a big deal for how often I use it. I've also changed the setting to quiet mode and that helps some. Great printer!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan G Weber

customer_reviews.title: the wireless capability makes it useful for the entire household
customer_reviews.text: Works a treat, the wireless capability makes it useful for the entire household. Love the low cost of the off-brand ink from Blake Printing Supply, we have used that ink in the printer since day one and have no loss of quality issues. Could not be happier with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. Schaefer

customer_reviews.title: Only works for about 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Loved it so much I bought 2, then I ordered the ink in amazon for $8. Update, about two years in the printer decided it no longer wants to work. Apparently the manufacturer is aware that a piece of it malfunctions which literally prevents it from printing, and they sell it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Deisy

product_meta.title: Canon Pixma MG5620 Wireless All-in-one Inkjet Color Cloud Printer with Scanner, Copier and Airprint Compatible, Black
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style:PrinterPrinting from your Tablet, Smartphone, or the Cloud can be easy. With the Cloud print function you can print directly from select online cloud services either at the printer itself or with your mobile device using the free PPS app.
feature_bullets: AirPrint: Print wirelessly and effortlessly from your compatible iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch- no drivers needed!
Easily print wirelessly from your Android, iPhone or tablet via Canon PRINT app and Google Cloud Print.
Compatible with Individual/Combo CLI-251 XL Ink Tanks (Cyan, Magenta, Yellow, Black) & PGI-250 XL Pigment Black Ink Tanks. Only replace the inks that run out!
Get amazing color and detail with five individual ink tanks.
Print from multiple mobile devices with ease.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars832 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
